content.description:
A short sport line. Follows the left arete, and then traverses right. Slopey top-out. 

Left most route here. Only bolted line. 

4 bolts. 2 bolt anchor with chains.

climbs.name: Pancake Flake
climbs.fa: M. Curan, J. Simpson, J. Molnar

content.description:
Follows the right-hand side of the obvious large flake. Fun.


Crack is hand to fist+ size. Takes hexes well. For cams, it will take a #2 or orange totem at bottom and then some #3's and #4's higher up. I think it might even take a #5 near the top of the flake. 2 bolt anchor with chains.

Consider stick clipping the first bolt as it is very high. The scramble up the ledge is rather trivial but the stance to clip the first bolt has poor feet. First crux is between 2nd and 3rd bolt. The second crux is just a couple of grovel moves in the chimney. This thing was bolted very well and, if you can reach, you should try clipping the fourth bolt before you fully commit to the chimney because if you blow it you'll get shredded on the sharp ledge in your back.



The corner of pancake flake. The bolts are painted as to preserve the aesthetic of the rock but as of AUG2022 they are in excellent condition. Don't let the paint fool you into thinking they are corroded or worn (I was skeptical at first).

4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with quick links.
Small cliff. A mixture of trad, sport, and aid lines.
